title: Premade trying to force me out of my role in flex
body: So I was playing flex with my buddy and we got into a lobby and the jungler ask if he can mid I say no. I was already hovering my champion and the ADC bans my champ {{champion:245}}. The guy pretends he did not see and said he meant to ban draven. The jungler asks again if he can have mid now that my champ was banned so I was skeptical. I do a quick look up and see that they are premade. Is there a way to prevent this kind of abuse and should this be a reportable and temporarily banned offense (I would say yes). I ended up playing Ziggs and we won the game by a landslide but I still do not like this kind of behavior, and why would anyone think it is ok to force someone out of a role?

replies.body:
I'll say the same as the others:

It's a *reeeaaaallly* dick move, but it's not punishable to ban your teammates champ.

> [{quoted}](name=RallerenP,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vLlRj4al,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-02-06T00:02:53.347+0000)
>
> I'll say the same as the others:
> 
> It's a *reeeaaaallly* dick move, but it's not punishable to ban your teammates champ.

can we agree on a either chat ban or a low priority queue like 1-5 games for behavior like this or something. I think it should be something I am not saying this is permanent ban worthy but it should be discouraged heavily. I dont have this issue often but I have heard of many people taking advantage of these things especially in lower divisions.

Absolutely. 

If we can reasonably verify someones intent when banning a teammates champion, then they should be punished. I don't know how such a system would even work (it would require a ton of planning), but I'm all for punishing trolls.

In your specific case, I'd agree that a punishment should be in place. Sadly, I don't make the rules :(

Technically that already does exist, you just need to send a support ticket/report the players and provide actual evidence (like the player straight up admitting in chat that they banned your champ with malicious intent). But I am all for a better system that punishes trolls

but he did not forcibly go mid and take over the lane.  banning your intent if on purpose is a dick move, but one that is not against the rules.

i suppose the way to prevent abuse is not to hover your intent

I do this to prevent my champ from being banned as some people in the past have, because Ekko "tilts them".

Then it is an unfortunate risk you must take either way.

I do not support being unable to ban your teammate intent because it will bring almost as much new problems as it would try to solve your current one.

For example, I ban all newly released champ 90% of the time regardless if my teammate intent on him/her.  Rito is nortorious for overbuff new champion and then nerf him/her accordingly the next patch.  I prefer new champion in my games after at least 1 patch iteration.
You don't hover.  People are assholes.  Also, never give into the tactic.  They do it because they think it works.

play your most fun champ and do your best to play the game i mean if they sabotaged you they deserve the loss. honestly in my opinion it may be ranked but those games who have trolls dont matter. play the most fun champ you can think of despite low skill cap and not give a F.
